frontmatter.title: Goodbye linear layers, hello full convolution

markdownRemark.html:
Did you know that all fully connected layers in neural networks can be replaced with convolutional layers? This means that networks that first applies convolutional layers for feature extraction, and then applies fully connected linear layers for classification, can be made fully convolutional. Or in other words, an MLP can be represented by convolution layers only.
